intro: Spermacoce brittonii, commonly known as the brittleweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and thrives in partial shade. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
